hooks.prompt:
Validate content being saved to Notion.

Tool input: $TOOL_INPUT

## Detection
Identify content type from structure:
- PRD: Has '## Problem', '## User Stories', '## Success Criteria'
- Exploration: Has '## Problem Statement', '## Options', '## Recommendation'
- User Flow: Has '```mermaid' and 'flowchart'

If NONE of these types, respond:
{"decision": "approve", "reason": "Not a Vorbit document type"}

## PRD Validation
- Name: 3-8 words, no technical jargon
- Problem: Max 3 sentences, no tech details
- User Stories: 'As a [user], I want [goal], so that [benefit]' format
- Success Criteria: Contains measurable numbers
- No [UNCLEAR] or [TBD] markers

## Exploration Validation
- Problem Statement: One sentence, identifies root cause
- Options: 2-3 approaches with Pros/Cons/Effort/Risk
- Recommendation: Addresses constraints

## User Flow Validation
- Single entry point
- At least one success exit
- All decision paths labeled
- Max 15 nodes (count shapes in mermaid)

## Response
If ALL rules pass:
{"decision": "approve", "reason": "Validation passed"}

If ANY rule fails:
{"decision": "ask", "message": "Validation issues found:\n1. [issue]\n2. [issue]\n\nSave anyway?"}

Respond with JSON only.

Validate Linear issue before creation.

Tool input: $TOOL_INPUT

## Title Validation
- Must be kebab-case (lowercase, hyphens only)
- Must start with action verb: add-, implement-, fix-, update-, remove-
- Max 50 characters
- No special characters except hyphens
- Must work as git branch name

## Description Validation
- Must contain '## Summary' or '## User Story' section
- Must contain '## Acceptance Criteria' section
- Acceptance criteria should be checkboxes: '- [ ]'

## Response
If ALL rules pass:
{"decision": "approve", "reason": "Issue validation passed"}

If ANY rule fails:
{"decision": "ask", "message": "Issue validation issues:\n1. [issue]\n\nCreate anyway?"}

Respond with JSON only.
